channel.title: MSDN Just Published
channel.description: Keep current with all the new technical articles, columns, specifications, and resources published on the Microsoft Developer Network (MSDN).

item.title: That's Totally Disco
item.description: Clint Rutkas describes his months-long quest to create a party dance floor for him and his friends to enjoy by combining his MacGyver-like talents with hardware and Visual C#.
item.dc:creator: Clint Rutkas

item.title: Building a WPF Sudoku Game Part 2: The Board UI and Validation
item.description: In his second tutorial, Lucas Magder covers developing a custom control for the Sudoku board and databinding it to the game logic, using the advanced databinding features found in Windows Presentation Foundation.
item.dc:creator: Lucas Magder

item.title: Speed Development With Custom Application Blocks For Enterprise Library
item.description: Learn how to build your own application block that integrates with the patterns & practices Enterprise Library application blocks.
item.dc:creator: Mark Seemann

item.title: ASP.NET Atlas Powers the AJAX-Style Sites You’ve Been Waiting For
item.description: See how Atlas allows you to build AJAX-Style sites with this upcoming technology from ASP.NET.
item.dc:creator: Matt Gibbs

item.title: Tutorial 1: Creating a Data Access Layer
item.description: When building a Web application creating the DAL should be one of your first steps, occurring before you start creating your presentation layer. With Visual Studio, creating a DAL based on Typed DataSets is a task you can accomplish in 10-15 minutes.
item.dc:creator: Scott Mitchell

item.title: The ADO.NET Entity Framework Overview - Making the Conceptual Level Real
item.description: Eliminate the impedance mismatch between data models and between languages that application developers would otherwise have to deal with with new features available in the upcoming version of ADO.NET.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft

item.title: Next-Generation Data Access: Making the Conceptual Level Real
item.description: Eliminate the impedance mismatch for both applications and data services like reporting, analysis, and replication offered as part of the SQL Server product by raising the level of abstraction from the logical level to the conceptual level.
item.dc:creator: José Blakeley; David Campbell; Jim Gray; S. Muralidhar; Anil Nori

item.title: Learn about Visual Studio Code Name "Orcas"
item.description: Find out more about Visual Studio Code Name “Orcas”, the upcoming release of Visual Studio for Windows Vista and the 2007 Office System.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft

item.title: Best Practices: Using Disposable Windows SharePoint Services Objects
item.description: Learn the appropriate ways to write your code when using Microsoft Windows SharePoint Services objects so that you can avoid retaining the objects in memory with the Microsoft .NET Framework.
item.dc:creator: Mike Ammerlan, Scott Harris

item.title: Code Security Changes in Outlook 2007
item.description: Microsoft Office Outlook 2007 enhances code security to help protect Outlook users against malicious code while reducing security warnings for developers and users. Find out how these changes make developing and using Outlook solutions easier while mainta
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gregg

item.title: Outlook 2007 Sample Add-ins: Rules Add-in, Travel Agency Add-in, and Prepare for Meeting Add-in
item.description: Outlook 2007 introduces many enhancements to its object model that enable you to create richer solutions. Three sample add-ins, the Rules add-in, Travel Agency add-in, and Prepare for Meeting add-in are available in both Visual Basic .NET and C#.
item.dc:creator: Randy Byrne; Ryan Gregg

item.title: Walkthrough: Word 2007 XML Format
item.description: Walk through the new default file format for Microsoft Office Word 2007. Read detailed descriptions of the file format architecture, key components, and ways in which you can programmatically modify content.
item.dc:creator: Erika Ehrli

item.title: Windows Communication Foundation Bindings and Channels
item.description: Clemens Vasters explains what "bindings" are and how they control the construction of the Windows Communication Foundation channel stack at runtime and what that channel stack is to begin with.
item.dc:creator: Clemens Vasters

item.title: Hosting the InfoPath 2007 Form Editing Environment in a Custom Web Form
item.description: Learn how to use the XmlFormView ASP.NET control, together with InfoPath Forms Services, to create custom Web pages to render Web-enabled, interactive InfoPath forms.
item.dc:creator: Mike Talley

item.title: .NET Rocks! - Michael Stiefel Gets Us Into the Windows Workflow
item.description: Michael Stiefel talks to us about what the Windows Workflow Foundation is and why we want to use it.
item.dc:creator: Carl Franklin

item.title: Video Game Development: Learn to Write C# the Fun Way
item.description: Learn a fun way to write in C#! Instructors from the DigiPen Institute of Technology introduce participants to the concepts of 3-D video game production in this on-demand webcast series.

item.title: Keep Sites Running Smoothly By Avoiding These 10 Common ASP.NET Pitfalls
item.description: Read about 10 of the pitfalls that can litter the path to releasing your production ASP.NET applications, and what you can do to avoid them.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Prosise

item.title: Project Glidepath public beta has launched!
item.description: Visit http://www.projectglidepath.net to participate in the Microsoft MicroISV Evangelism program that delivers an in-Visual-Studio experience providing the workflow-based guidance, sample code and technology to create applications for Windows Vista.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft

item.title: 12 Finalists Announced in $10,000 Made in Express Contest
item.description: What do an all terrain self-maneuverable robot, an instant IM translator, and a curmudgeon chat bot all have in common? Answer – they are all being built by finalists in the Made In Express Contest. Check out these cool projects!

item.title: Get Your Applications Ready for Windows Vista
item.description: DevReadiness.org is the developer community site to help you get your applications ready for Windows Vista. Learn how to test your application for Windows Vista, and find simple remedies to fix the most common issues.

item.title: Introducing .NET Framework 3.0
item.description: Vice President S. Somasegar describes the decision to rename WinFX to the .NET Framework 3.0. Now the WinFX technology you know has a name that identifies it for exactly what it is – the next version of Microsoft’s developer framework.
item.dc:creator: S. Somasegar

item.title: Identity and Access Management Center
item.description: This center collects the most current information, tools and technology downloads, articles, media, and communities to aid developers in design, development, and testing of identity-aware, directory-enabled applications.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Refactoring in Visual Basic 2005
item.description: Jay Schmelzer talks about source code refactoring and provides a demo of Refactor! for Visual Basic 2005, a free tool from Developer Express, Inc. that adds refactoring support to the Visual Basic 2005 development environment.
item.dc:creator: Jay Schmelzer

item.title: The .NET Developer’s Guide to Identity
item.description: A roadmap for developers and architects who want to learn how to build identity-aware applications on the Windows platform. From authentication and authorization to federated identity, you’ll discover techniques that can be used today and in the future.
item.dc:creator: Keith Brown

item.title: Microsoft Visual Studio Team Edition for Software Developers
item.description: Describes the features available in Microsoft Visual Studio Team Edition for Software Developers for improving code quality.
item.dc:creator: Eric Lee Microsoft Corporation
item.category: Visual Studio 2005 Team Edition for Software Developers

item.title: Customize the Visual Studio 2005 Debugger Display of Your Data
item.description: Calvin Hsia illustrates ways to customize the Visual Studio 2005 Debugger to get the most out of your debugging time.
item.dc:creator: Calvin Hsia

item.title: Beyond Membership: Using the Provider Design Pattern For Custom Features
item.description: ASP.NET 2.0 offers an abstract membership API for adding authentication and membership management functionality to your applications with the Provider Pattern. Aaron Murrell shows how to implement it.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Murrell

item.title: Identity and Access Management
item.description: The Identity and Access Management site features the most current information, tools/technology downloads, articles, media, and communities to aid developers in their design, development, and testing of identity-aware, directory-enabled applications.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: .NET Rocks! - Brian Randell Checks In on Virtualization
item.description: Brian Randell talks about Virtual Machines today and tomorrow, and boasts a bit about his new monster of a machine. The discussion also touches on the rift between Microsoft and Adobe over PDF support in Office "12".
item.dc:creator: Carl Franklin

item.title: Join our slow chat on Visual C++
item.description: During the week of June 19th, the Visual C++ team will be hosting a slow chat titled "Visual C++: Yesterday, Today and Tomorrow" on CodeGuru (www.codeguru.com). For this slow chat we’ll be discussing the history & evolution of Visual C++. Please join us!
item.dc:creator: Microsoft

item.title: patterns and practices Goes Mobile!
item.description: The Microsoft patterns & practices team has released the first Community Technical Preview (CTP) for the Mobile Client Software Factory. The factory will help architects and developers design and build mobile LOB solutions.

item.title: Download the Visual Studio 2005 Fix for Working with Large Visual C++ Solutions
item.description: Visual Studio 2005 IDE (KB:916769) will sometimes stop functioning (hang) when working with large Microsoft Visual C++ solutions on computers with a single, non hyper-threaded processor. The Visual C++ team has has created a patch that fixes this problem.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft

item.title: Isolating Microsoft Office Extensions with the COM Shim Wizard
item.description: Learn about a set of new Microsoft Visual Studio 2005 wizards that automate the generation of COM shims for managed Microsoft Office extensions that do not use Microsoft Visual Studio 2005 Tools for the Microsoft Office System.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Whitechapel

item.title: 2007 Office System Document: Lists of Control IDs
item.description: This download contains files that list the control IDs for built-in controls in all applications that use the Ribbon.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Customizing the Office (2007) Ribbon User Interface for Developers (Part 1 of 2)
item.description: Learn about the scenarios and XML markup that you can use to customize the Ribbon user interface (UI) in the 2007 Microsoft Office release. The Ribbon UI replaces menus, toolbars, and most of the task pane UI in the 2007 release.
item.dc:creator: Frank Rice

item.title: Customizing the Office (2007) Ribbon User Interface for Developers (Part 2 of 2)
item.description: This article is the companion to the part-one article of the same name. This article contains detailed reference material about the controls and method signatures for the Ribbon user interface, and a section of frequently asked questions. With this inform
item.dc:creator: Frank Rice

item.title: Developer Introduction to Workflows for Windows SharePoint Services V3 and SharePoint Server 2007
item.description: Get a high-level overview of how Windows SharePoint Services (v3) implements the workflow capabilities of the Windows Workflow Foundation, and how SharePoint Server 2007 extends those capabilities with symmetrical InfoPath 2007 forms.
item.dc:creator: Andrew May

item.title: Developer Overview of the User Interface for the 2007 Microsoft Office System
item.description: Read an overview of the user interface (UI) system for the 2007 release of the Microsoft Office applications and the goals behind the redesign of the UI. Learn about the impact of the redesigned UI on custom solutions and add-ins.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Extending the Office (2007) Fixed-Format Export Feature
item.description: Create a COM add-in for an application in the 2007 Microsoft Office release, such as Microsoft Office Publisher 2007, that extends the Office fixed-format export feature to support new formats. The technique described requires knowledge of C++ and COM.
item.dc:creator: Carl Parker

item.title: Hosting the InfoPath Form Editing Environment in a Custom Windows Form Application
item.description: Learn how to incorporate this control into your application, work with the XML data generated by the Form Control, and use IOLECommands to replicate functionality of the InfoPath 2007 form editing environment.
item.dc:creator: Mike Talley

item.title: Introducing the Microsoft Office (2007) Open XML File Formats
item.description: Learn the benefits of the Microsoft Office (2007) Open XML Formats. Users can exchange data between Office applications and enterprise systems using XML and ZIP technologies. Documents are universally accessible. And, you reduce the risk of damaged files.
item.dc:creator: Frank Rice

item.title: Project Server 2007: Getting Started with a New Platform for Developers
item.description: Explore the Microsoft Office Project Server 2007 functionality that uses a completely new platform built on the Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 and Microsoft Windows SharePoint Services (version 3).
item.dc:creator: Jim Corbin

item.title: SharePoint Server 2007 for MCMS 2002 Developers
item.description: Explore SharePoint Server 2007, which merges functionality of MCMS 2002 and SharePoint Portal Server 2003 with new functionality to create one integrated set of technologies built on Windows SharePoint Services V3.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: What's New for Developers in the Outlook 2007 Object Model (Part 1 of 2)
item.description: This article provides a top-level view of the enhancements and additions for developers in Microsoft Office Outlook 2007.
item.dc:creator: Randy Byrne

item.title: What's New for Developers in Microsoft Office Outlook 2007 (Part 2 of 2)
item.description: Part 2 of this article continues discussing the enhancements and additions for developers in Microsoft Office Outlook 2007. This article is accompanied by the What's New Add-In, which is available as a download.
item.dc:creator: Randy Byrne

item.title: What's New for Developers in OneNote 2007 (Part 1 of 2)
item.description: This article is part one of a two-part series introducing and explaining new features of interest to developers in Microsoft Office OneNote 2007. Developer-related features include a new COM API that offers new import, export, selection, and search functi
item.dc:creator: Saul Candib

item.title: What's New for Developers in OneNote 2007 (Part 2 of 2)
item.description: This article is part two of a two-part series introducing and explaining the new features of interest to developers in Microsoft Office OneNote 2007. Developer-related features include a new COM API that offers new import, export, selection, and search fu
item.dc:creator: Saul Candib

item.title: What's New for Developers in Word 2007
item.description: This article provides a high-level overview of new features for developers in Microsoft Office Word 2007 Beta 2. The article reviews content controls, XML mapping, document building blocks, the Word XML Format, and other new features.
item.dc:creator: Erika Ehrli

item.title: Building a Better MSDN Search
item.description: Jeremiah Andrick talks about how MSDN is working to improve the discoverability of content and how you can help to make it better.
item.dc:creator: Jeremiah Andrick

item.title: .NET Rocks! - Kimberly Tripp on SQL Server 2005 SP1 and More
item.description: In this episode, the always mind-bending Kimberly Tripp talks to us about improvements in SQL Server 2005 Service Pack 1, converting Oracle users to SQL Server, and much more.
item.dc:creator: Carl Franklin

item.title: Delta Compression Application Programming Interface
item.description: Delta Compression is a differential compression technology developed by Microsoft. This document set discuss Delta Compression Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) currently available in the Windows Platform.
item.dc:creator: Chul Kim

item.title: Announcing! Visual Studio Team Edition for Database Professionals
item.description: Microsoft announces Visual Studio Team Edition for Database Professionals, a market-shifting database development product designed to manage database change and bring the benefits of life cycle development to the database professional.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft

item.title: Overview of Text and Flow Layout in Windows Presentation Foundation
item.description: Chris Han and Amar Atwal demo text and flow layout features in Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) that allow you to take real world print ideas and translate them into the digital medium.
item.dc:creator: Chris Han and Amar Atwal

item.title: .NET Rocks! - Live at SDC, The Netherlands
item.description: Carl and Richard were at the Software Developer Network Conference in Arnhem, The Netherlands last week. They took the portable rig and captured some memorable moments with attendees, speakers, and staff.
item.dc:creator: Carl Franklin

item.title: Motion Lite - A Rapid Application of the Business Architecture Techniques Used by Microsoft Motion
item.description: This article provides an introduction to the Motion Lite methodology for project prioritization and selection, using a case study to illustrate the applicability of the methodology.
item.dc:creator: Ric Merrifield; Jon Tobey

item.title: Kid's Programming Language: Missile Command!
item.description: Jon Schwartz and Larry Serflaten present the Kid's Programming Language (KPL) version of Missile Command and build on earlier KPL games by adding more 3D support, creating more sophisticated event handling, and controlling the game sound features.
item.dc:creator: Jon Schwartz and Larry Serflaten

item.title: Whitespace Handling in XSLT Transformation
item.description: Explores whitespace handling in XSLT transformation applications, using the managed XslCompiledTransform class, the native MSXML DOMDocument object, and Internet Explorer and XSLT Debugger tools.
item.dc:creator: Mohan Vanmane

item.title: Windows Vista and 2007 Microsoft Office System Betas Available
item.description: Join the Windows Vista and 2007 Microsoft Office System Beta Experience. Download or order the betas, and get bonus material and valuable resources.

item.title: Customizing the Office (2007) Document Inspector
item.description: Learn to customize the Document Inspector in 2007 Microsoft Office suites. Users now have one place to find metadata or hidden information in their documents and to take action. And, developers can create custom modules for special circumstances.
item.dc:creator: Frank Rice

item.title: Creating Word 2007 Templates Programmatically
item.description: Read details about how to create document templates programmatically for Microsoft Office Word 2007, including information about using the new content controls, document building blocks, and XML mapping. Review some of the newest members of the Word 2007
item.dc:creator: Erika Erhli

item.title: Creating Office (2007) Custom Task Panes
item.description: The 2007 release of the Microsoft Office system introduces custom task panes that give you the tools to put the features and information your customers need when and where they want them. Learn how you can use custom task panes in your applications.
item.dc:creator: Frank Rice

item.title: Office 2007 Video: Extending the Office UI with Custom Ribbon in Word, Excel, or PowerPoint
item.description: Download this series of developer-oriented videos to view virtual tours of new features in the 2007 Microsoft Office system.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Office 2007 Video: Developing Solutions Using The Consolidated Outlook Object Model
item.description: Learn about new platform features in Microsoft Office Outlook 2007.
item.dc:creator: Erica Wiechers

item.title: Office 2007 Video: Creating Custom Document Information Panels
item.description: Download this series of developer-oriented videos to view virtual tours of new features in the 2007 Microsoft Office system.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Office 2007 Video: Creating and Using Content Types in Windows SharePoint Services 3.0
item.description: Download this series of developer-oriented videos to view virtual tours of new features in the 2007 Microsoft Office system.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Office 2007 Video: Building ASP.NET Web Parts for Windows SharePoint Services V3
item.description: Download this series of developer-oriented videos to view virtual tours of new features in the 2007 Microsoft Office system.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Groove 2007: Software Development Kit
item.description: The Groove 2007 SDK (Beta) contains documentation, WSDL, and sample code for applications that use Groove Web Services. In addition, the SDK contains developer documentation for the Groove 2007 Forms and Groove 2007 InfoPath Forms tools.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Visio 2007: Software Development Kit
item.description: The Beta 2 version of the Microsoft Office Visio 2007 SDK contains sample applications, code snippets, documentation, and tools, including the ShapeStudio, Event Monitor, Persistent Events, Print ShapeSheet, and Solution Publishing tools.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Beginning Game Development VIII: DirectSound
item.description: Derek Pierson is back with his latest article in the Beginning Game Development series. This time he focuses on the capabilities of DirectSound, delving into the world of 3D sound and showing you how to create a more immersive game experience.
item.dc:creator: Derek Pierson

item.title: You Can Take It With You, Part 2
item.description: In this second part of his article on mobility, Arian Kulp focuses on mobile network connectivity awareness. He discusses how to create applications that can handle dropped wireless connections and then resume when a new connection is available.
item.dc:creator: Arian Kulp

item.title: The .NET Show: IIS 7.0
item.description: Shipping with Windows Vista will be the latest version of Internet Information Services (IIS), which includes a broad collection of features and capabilities that have been anxiously awaited by both developers and IT Pros.
item.dc:creator: Robert Hess

item.title: Build Your Own ASP.NET Provider-Based Feature
item.description: Stefan Schackow shows how to author your own ASP.NET provider-based features by leveraging the provider model support in the .NET Framework 2.0 to quickly and easily build a pluggable and extensible provider layer.
item.dc:creator: Stefan Schackow

item.title: .NET Rocks! - Michele Leroux Bustamante on Indigo
item.description: Carl and Richard talk to Michele Leroux Bustamante about the state of Windows Communication Foundation (formerly referred to as "Indigo"). If you are designing a Web services-based (or distributed) system now, you should be using WCF.
item.dc:creator: Carl Franklin

item.title: Reports Windows Sample Application Guide
item.description: Provides instructional information that describes many of the Microsoft development features used in the Reports Web sample application.
item.dc:creator: Tim Tow

item.title: Reports Web Sample Application Guide
item.description: Provides instructional information for the Microsoft development features used in the Reports Windows sample application.
item.dc:creator: Tim Tow

item.title: Collection Manager Sample Application Guide
item.description: Provides instructional information for the Microsoft development features used in the Collection Manager sample application.
item.dc:creator: Tim Tow

item.title: Guidelines for Test-Driven Development
item.description: Find out how to incorporate Visual Studio Team System into Test-Driven development practices emphasized in Agile development methodologies.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Palermo
item.category: Visual Studio 2005 Team Edition for Software Developers
Visual Studio 2005 Team Edition for Software Testers

item.title: The Multi-Channel Paradigm: Reaching Customers with a Consistent and Integrated Experience
item.description: This article provides an introduction to multi-channel retailing, and discusses the advantages of a unified multi-channel architecture.
item.dc:creator: Nick Lewis

item.title: An MSDN Architecture Chat about Software as a Service with Gianpaolo Carraro
item.description: Review a chat about Software as a Service (SaaS) and the implications for enterprise architects and Independent Software Vendors (ISVs).
item.dc:creator: Diego Dagum

item.title: Challenges In Today’s U.S. Supermarket Industry
item.description: This article provides an overview of the challenges facing the supermarket industry in the U.S, from a technological perspective, and it provides recommendations for how retailers can gain a competitive advantage through the effective use of current and e
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Using Data with Web Application Projects
item.description: Shows how to properly use SQL Server Express and Data Binding with Web Application Projects, an alternative Web project model that can be added to Visual Studio 2005
item.dc:creator: Wendy Wei

item.title: Deploying contemporary applications with ClickOnce
item.description: Bill Sempf looks at ClickOnce deployment from the perspective of a Visual Basic 6.0 developer and compares it to VB 6.0 deployment methods.
item.dc:creator: Bill Sempf

item.title: Announcing the Upgrade Your Game Arcade Machine Sweepstakes!
item.description: Check out these free game developer learning resources that teach you, step-by-step, how to develop your own arcade games on the PC, and enter to win a Ms Pacman/Galaga arcade machine!

item.title: Model-Driven Development of .NET Enterprise Applications
item.description: Explores the role of domain-specific languages and Visual Studio 2005 Domain Specific Language Tools (DSLs) and show how they can be used to automate the generation of an enterprise application for the .NET platform.
item.dc:creator: Susan Entwisle and Steve Eadie, EDS

item.title: Managing A Custom Shell via Active Directory
item.description: This article introduces Windows policy-based management, which provides an easy, simplified approach to securing the desktop for point of service, and it explains how to do this across a retail organization.

item.title: Installing and Deploying WEPOS in Challenging Environments
item.description: This article explains how to install Windows Embedded for Point of Service on a machine that does not have a bootable CD or a PXE-compliant network interface card.
item.dc:creator: Clay Morrisette

item.title: Microsoft OS Comparison for Point of Service Devices
item.description: This set of frequently asked questions is aimed at helping decide which Windows operating system is most appropriate for a retail or hospitality organization's point of service (POS) devices.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Enterprise Integration - Guidance for Retail Solution Architects
item.description: Serving the needs of both business stakeholders and enterprise architects requires a practical approach to enterprise integration and service oriented design; learn how with tips in this article.
item.dc:creator: Nick Lewis

item.title: Guide to the MSDN Retail Industry Center
item.description: This FAQ addresses common questions regarding the intent, content, scope, and long term plans for the Retail Industry Center.
item.dc:creator: Tim Gruver, Nick Lewis

item.title: Retail and Hospitality Industry Standards: (Part 1)
item.description: This article explains why retail industry standards are important and beneficial, and it examines the role of the Association of Retail Technology Standards in addressing and implementing standardization goals for the retail industry.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Gaining Supply Chain Efficiency through Global Data Synchronization
item.description: This article examines how the trading of item data and the ordering of trade items in the supply chain can be made more efficient by integrating processes and systems, and by leveraging standards.
item.dc:creator: David Barkwell and Winson Woo

item.title: Building Rich Interactive Kiosks
item.description: This paper will provide an overview of the new technologies in Windows Vista that will enable developers to create a new generation of retail kiosks, and it will relate these technologies to benefits a developer will see for creating rich kiosk solutions.
item.dc:creator: Mike Graber

item.title: Securing the Retail Store Series
item.description: This three-part series discusses the Microsoft vision of retail store security. It provides a technical roadmap to achieve this vision, and discusses the alternative solutions where infrastructure, cost, and complexity constraints exist.
item.dc:creator: Nick Lewis

item.title: Welcome Letter from Brian Scott, VP Microsoft Retail & Hospitality
item.description: Taking Vision to Reality—Enabling the Technology to Drive Retail Innovation
item.dc:creator: Brian Scott

item.title: New specifications enable browser-based Web Single Sign-On (SSO) between security domains that use Liberty ID-FF and WS-Federation
item.description: Customer feedback has driven the development of two specs to enable browser-based Web single sign-on across domains. The Web Single Sign-On Interoperability Profile and Web Single Sign-On Metadata Exchange Protocol specs define interoperability between Liberty Identity Federation and WS-Federation for WebSSO.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft et al

item.title: Where Did My Icons Go?
item.description: Review the host of improvements and new features that make the Microsoft Visual Studio 2005 integrated development environment (IDE) even more impressive than its predecessors.
item.dc:creator: Devin Rader

item.title: The Laws of Identity
item.description: Defining a set of fundamental principles to which any universally adopted, sustainable identity architecture must conform, the "Laws of Identity" were proposed, debated, and refined through an open and continuing dialogue on the Internet.
item.dc:creator: Kim Cameron

item.title: Microsoft's Vision for an Identity Metasystem
item.description: The Identity Metasystem is an interoperable architecture for digital identity that assumes people will have several digital identities based on multiple underlying technologies, implementations, and providers.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corp.

item.title: Improving Application Performance by Implementing Paginated Lists
item.description: Describes how Ameripay has implemented the "How To: Page Records in .NET Applications" section of the Microsoft patterns & practices book Improving .NET Application Performance and Scalability.
item.dc:creator: Chuck Cooper

item.title: Data Cleansing Applications with SQL Server Integration Services
item.description: Data quality is a critical issue in data integration. Donald Farmer introduces the data quality features of SQL Server Integration Services with demos that show how to use the Fuzzy Lookup component for inexact matching and how to use Data Mining within the data integration process.
item.dc:creator: Donald Farmer
